intro: Osteospermum auriculatum, commonly known as the ear-shaped daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Osteospermum auriculatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
